page.title: 09SCOUT HALL LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: Building started on the new scout hall at the beginning of 1985 and was finished in Easter 1985. It was opened on the 6th of April by Councillor Hossack. The old scout hall was in a bad state of repair which was why a new hall was built. The money came from jumble sales and other fund raising activities. The scouts raised thirteen thousand pounds and they got a grant of thirty-nine thousand pounds from Moray District Council. The facilities that are in the hall include a kitchen, toilets, 2 stores and an office. The hut is used by 18 scouts, also cubs and Venture Scouts. The scouts think the hall is good but dampness is getting in already and damaging the walls, making them mouldy.
